info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 2:19AM EDT until April 7 at 8:18AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Indiana...
Flatrock River at Saint Paul.
Fall Creek near Fortville.
.Widespread and significant flooding is in progress. Rainfall amounts of three to over six inches have fallen over the past few days.
* WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Flatrock River at Saint Paul.
* WHEN...Until tomorrow morning.
* IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Flooding occurs along Flatrock River in southern Shelby County. Towns affected include Geneva and Flat Rock.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 10.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:45 AM EDT Sunday was 10.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this afternoon by around 530 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING
